programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Ethel tries to get a china horse, supposedly from the Ming Dynasty, away from Helen.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mr. Roper decides to fix Jenny up with Brookes' nephew and Brookes freaks out upon learning about it.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's and David's birthday party is a disaster when first Stanley and Jeffrey and then Helen and Anne start squabbling.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack is asked to identify a counterfeiter, Mr. Bradford appears in the police lineup.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Brad forces Jackie to choose between being his wife or having a career.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry brings a hungry Andrew to a photo session so Muriel can nurse him.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rush family's Christmas ski trip to Mammoth has to be cancelled when Andrew comes down with a fever. As they plan Christmas at home, Jackie brings home a friend from the store she works in, Mr. Christmas, a black Santa who really believes he is Santa Claus.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Iris falls for a fortune hunter and it is up to Henry to save her from heartbreak.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Sara is the victim of questionable journalism practices when a picture of her face is put on a nude body in a men's magazine.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry and Monroe come to the aid of Wainwright's attractive young messenger who faints in the Rushes' apartment.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Iris's revelation that Muriel was adopted sends Muriel searching for her natural mother.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rushes hire a pair of hapless brothers to convert their attic into an apartment for Iris.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The wedding of Henry's lifelong friend to a young Las Vegas showgirl upsets the groom's sons from his previous marriage.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister puts Christian in charge of Cobbs while he goes on vacation. Christian makes life so miserable for the rest of the staff, they snitch when Bannister gets back. For revenge, Christian tells Marlene she's won a trip, but this backfires when Marlene gets her grandmother involved.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: One of Cobb's favorite customers is Mr. Dale, an old vaudeville comic. When Mr. Dale reveals his retirement home will close unless money is raised, Bannister gives him a job at Cobb's.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: While showing his children's birthday party routine to Edna, TC arrives at Cobb's with a corporate psychiatrist.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene is approached by a writer for 'Women of the World' magazine, who wants to interview her. Bannister tries to convince her not to do it, when it's revealed that Marlene must pose nude!

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mrs. Roper thinks her husband is having an affair when she finds his hidden stash of love letters , written to a woman named Doris.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley is jealous when Helen wants to reunite with an old boyfriend who is in town, so he tries to reconnect with an old girlfriend to get even with her. Also, David trades Jeffrey's model train set for Stanley's old inner tube.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Edna learns her good friend will be in town to talk about her recent marriage. Cathy has only good things to say which makes Edna scared that her own relationship is failing.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: As her converted apartment nears completion, Iris sells her condo, but is suddenly offered a partnership in a Chicago travel agency.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry invites his down-and-out Navy buddy to dinner and is shocked to learn that he is gay.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Jackie considers a breast-implant operation thinking it will improve her love life.

programme.sub-title: Home is Where the Bart is
programme.desc: When the city announces plans to build a subway station on their block, the Rushes mobilize the neighbors to save their neighborhood.

programme.desc: Henry's life is threatened after he positively identifies the gunman in a robbery.

programme.desc: Henry turns to Mildred Rafkin for inspiration when he develops a writer's block.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe's visit with his father goes from bad to worse when Monroe catches him with another woman.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry's father surprises everyone when he comes to visit with Cora, a fortyish woman pregnant with Huey's child.

programme.sub-title: Is There a Doctor in the House?

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene's friendship with a young couple seems to be blossoming into something more. They want her to be their surrogate mother and she agrees.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene introduces Christian to her friend Barbara and the two of them have an instant attraction to each other. He is shocked to learn that Barbara has a 10 year old son. Bannister is planning on hosting a circus.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Derek the bagboy has a special admiration for Bannister. Everything's going well until it's we learn that he plans on working at Cobb's forever in order to become the next Howard Bannister.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister hires a new cashier at Cobb's. She takes a special liking to Bannister and one night while they're alone, she grabs him and kisses him. Bannister learns Kim has made a practice of suing her former bosses.

programme.desc: Whilst playing Santa at Susan's works Christmas party Ben becomes emotionally involved when a little girl asks him to reconcile her mother and grand-father, who have fallen out.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: On the day that Helen is making dinner to impress her rich sister, Ethel, the utilities are cut off because Stanley forgot to pay the bills. He goes to great lengths to hide his mistake.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A man shows up and claims to be Stanley's son. Stanley admits to know his mother, but doesn't remember the night that she claimed to conceive her son. Roper goes to talk to a friend who was with him at the time to find out if the claims are true.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack and Vicky are cast in a commercial for her airline, Jack fights with the temperamental director.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Janet loses her cool when the groovy guy and campus Adonis of her high school days shows up for a date, and Jack and Chrissy conspire to leave them alone in the apartment.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack, Janet and Chrissy plot to escape a boring Christmas party alone with the Ropers because the three roommates are invited to a big bash the same night.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack becomes caught in a dilemma when Chrissy believes he has bought her an expensive birthday present and the gift turns out to be a surprise for Roper's wife.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A tiny tyke terrorizes Jack and Chrissy with the threat of tears after Janet presses them into services as inexperienced substitute sitters.

programme.desc: Helen is convinced Stanley is having an affair when she sees him give a locket to another women.
